result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey John Burke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay financial obligations on Ct 1 directly to the Clerk of Court. Court waives financial obligation on Ct 2.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall have such assessments, treatment, counseling and programming as DOC deems appropriate. 
Defendant shall attend couples/family counseling until successful completion. If already completed, provide documentation to DOC.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeffrey John Burke in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kyle Robert Reimann in court for Jeffrey John Burke. Victim in court. Per agreement, State moves to amend Ct 1 to 940.41(1). Defendant will be pleading to both counts. State will recommend 2 years probation with the following condition: participate in couples counseling as long as the victim is willing, costs, and to provide DNA sample. Court grants amendment for Ct 1. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest to charges. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Victim does not wish to be heard. State heard. Attorney Reimann heard. Defendant does not wish to be heard. Court heard and orders 2 years probation with the following conditions: to have such assessment, treatment, counseling, and programming that DOC deems appropriate, to attend couples/family counseling until successful completion, if completed provide documentation to DOC, submit to DNA sample, not to possess or consume any alcohol, and to pay court costs on Ct 1, costs on Ct 2 are remitted.
